ABLE is a Bible paraphrase for special needs, intellectually challenged, and young learners.
ABLE is in the public domain and is released under both the CC0 and MIT licenses.
ABLE is a project of bibleable at bibleable.com.

ABLE - Bible Paraphrase for Special Needs

## Genesis 1:1
At first, God made the sky and the earth. ğŸŒâœ¨
## Genesis 1:2
The earth had no shape. It was empty and dark. Water was everywhere. God's Holy Spirit moved over the water. ğŸŒ‘ğŸŒŠğŸ•Šï¸
## Genesis 1:3
God said, â€œLight!â€ And light came. ğŸ’¡
## Genesis 1:4
God saw the light was good. God put light and dark apart. ğŸŒâ†”ï¸ğŸŒ‘
## Genesis 1:5
God named the light Day. God named the dark Night. It was evening. It was morning. Day 1. ğŸŒ‡ğŸŒ…1ï¸âƒ£
## Genesis 1:6
God said to make the sky to put the waters apart. â˜ï¸ğŸŒŠâ†”ï¸ğŸŒŠ

## Genesis 1:11

## Genesis 2:8

## Genesis 2:10

## Genesis 2:11

## Genesis 2:12

## Genesis 2:13

## Genesis 2:15

## Genesis 2:16

## Genesis 2:18

## Genesis 2:20
The man named all the animals and birds. But no animal was a good helper for him. ğŸ˜ğŸ»âŒ
## Genesis 2:21

## Genesis 2:22

## Genesis 3:1
The snake was tricky. The snake asked the woman, Did God say you cannot eat fruit from any tree? ğŸğŸâ“
## Genesis 3:2
The woman said, We can eat fruit from the trees. ğŸ‘©ğŸ
## Genesis 3:3
The woman said, God told us, Do not eat the fruit from the tree in the middle. Do not touch it. If we do, we will die. ğŸ‘©ğŸ—£ï¸ğŸŒ³ğŸš«
## Genesis 3:4
The snake said, You will not die. ğŸâœ‹
## Genesis 3:5
The snake said, When you eat it, your eyes will open. You will know good and bad, like God. ğŸ‘€ğŸ
## Genesis 3:6
The woman saw the tree looked good. She wanted the fruit. She took it and ate. She gave some to her man. He ate too. ğŸ‘©ğŸğŸ‘¨
## Genesis 3:7
Then their eyes were open. They knew they had no clothes. They made leaf clothes to cover. ğŸ‘€ğŸƒ
## Genesis 3:8
They heard the Lord God in the garden. It was a cool time. They hid in the trees. ğŸŒ³ğŸ™ˆ
## Genesis 3:9
The Lord God called to the man, Where are you? ğŸ—£ï¸
## Genesis 3:10
The man said, I heard You. I was afraid, because I had no clothes. So I hid. ğŸ‘¨ğŸ˜Ÿ
## Genesis 3:11

## Genesis 3:12

## Genesis 3:13

## Genesis 3:14

## Exodus 21:1
God said, â€œHere are the rules for you.â€ Moses must teach them. ğŸ“œğŸ—£ï¸
## Exodus 21:2

## Exodus 21:3

## Exodus 21:4

## Exodus 21:7

## Exodus 21:8

## Exodus 21:10

## Exodus 22:1
God said: If a man steals a cow or a sheep and kills it or sells it, he must pay back big: 5 cows for 1 cow, or 4 sheep for 1 sheep. ğŸ„â¡ï¸ğŸ„ğŸ„ğŸ„ğŸ„ğŸ„ | ğŸ‘â¡ï¸ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
## Exodus 22:2
If a robber breaks in at night and someone hits him and he dies, the one who hit is not in big trouble. ğŸŒ™ğŸ ğŸ¥·
## Exodus 22:3
But in day time, do not kill the robber. He must pay back. If he has no money, he will be sold to pay. â˜€ï¸ğŸ’°â†©ï¸
## Exodus 22:4
If the stolen animal is found alive with the robber, he must pay back two times. ğŸ‘ğŸ„ğŸ”2ï¸âƒ£
## Exodus 22:5
If your animal eats in a field that is not yours, you must pay back with the best from your own field. ğŸ„ğŸŒ¾â¡ï¸ğŸŒ¾âœ¨
## Exodus 22:6
If a fire starts and burns a field or grain, the one who started it must pay back. ğŸ”¥ğŸŒ¾
## Exodus 22:7
If you give your neighbor money or things to keep safe, and a thief takes them, and the thief is found, the thief must pay back two times. ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ’¼ğŸ’°ğŸ”â¡ï¸ğŸ¥·ğŸ”2ï¸âƒ£
## Exodus 22:8
If the thief is not found, the person who kept the things must go to God and say he did not take them. ğŸ™ğŸ—£ï¸
## Exodus 22:9
If two people fight about any lost thing, both must come to God. God will show who is wrong. That one must pay back two times. âš–ï¸ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ”2ï¸âƒ£
## Exodus 22:10
This rule is for when you give a donkey, cow, sheep, or other animal to a neighbor to keep safe, and it dies, is hurt, or runs away, and no one saw it. ğŸ´ğŸ„ğŸ‘â“
## Exodus 22:11
The neighbor must promise to God he did not take it. The owner must accept the promise. No pay back. ğŸ¤ğŸ™
## Exodus 22:12
But if it was stolen from him, he must pay back to the owner. ğŸ¥·ğŸ’°â†©ï¸
## Exodus 22:13
If a wild animal tore it, he must bring the torn piece to show. He does not have to pay back. ğŸºğŸ¦´
## Exodus 22:14
If a man borrows an animal, and it is hurt or dies, and the owner is not there, he must pay back. ğŸ„ğŸ¤ğŸ’¥
## Exodus 22:15
If the owner was there, no pay back. If it was rented, the rent money pays for it. ğŸ‘€ğŸ’µ
## Exodus 22:16

## Exodus 22:17

## Exodus 29:1

## Leviticus 1:1

## Leviticus 1:2

## Leviticus 1:3
If a man brings a cow or bull for a fire gift, it must be a boy with no bad spot. He brings it to the tent door because he wants to give. ğŸ‚ğŸšªğŸ”¥
## Leviticus 1:4

## Leviticus 1:5

## Leviticus 1:6

## Leviticus 1:10

## Leviticus 1:13

## Leviticus 1:14

## Leviticus 1:15

## Leviticus 2:1

## Leviticus 2:3

## Leviticus 2:5

## Leviticus 2:6

## Leviticus 2:7

## Leviticus 2:10

## Leviticus 2:11

## Leviticus 5:1

## Leviticus 11:1
God spoke to Moses and Aaron. ğŸ—£ï¸
## Leviticus 11:2

## Leviticus 11:3
You may eat any land animal with a foot split in two and that chews the food again. ğŸ„âœ…
## Leviticus 11:4
Do not eat the camel, the rock animal like a rabbit, or the rabbit. They chew and chew, but the foot is not split in two. ğŸªğŸª¨ğŸ°âŒ
## Leviticus 11:5
Do not eat the rock animal that lives by rocks. It chews again, but the foot is not split in two. ğŸª¨ğŸ¾âŒ
## Leviticus 11:6
Do not eat the rabbit. It chews again, but the foot is not split in two. ğŸ°âŒ
## Leviticus 11:7
Do not eat the pig. Its foot is split in two, but it does not chew again. ğŸ·âŒ
## Leviticus 11:8
Do not eat their meat. Do not touch their dead body. They are not clean for you. ğŸš«ğŸ–âœ‹ğŸ’€
## Leviticus 11:9
In the water, you may eat what has fins and scales. ğŸŸâœ…
## Leviticus 11:10

## Leviticus 11:11
Do not eat them. Do not touch their dead body. They are not clean for you. ğŸš«âœ‹
## Leviticus 11:12
Every water animal with no fins and no scales is not clean for you. ğŸŒŠâŒ
## Leviticus 11:13

## Leviticus 11:14

## Leviticus 11:15

## Leviticus 11:16

## Leviticus 11:17

## Leviticus 11:18

## Leviticus 11:19
Do not eat the stork, any heron, the hoopoe, or the bat. ğŸ¦©ğŸ¦‡âŒ
## Leviticus 11:20

## Leviticus 11:21
You may eat bugs that have back legs to hop. ğŸ¦—âœ…
## Leviticus 11:22

## Leviticus 11:23

## Leviticus 11:24

## Leviticus 11:25

## Leviticus 11:26

## Leviticus 11:27

## Leviticus 11:28
If you carry a dead one, wash your clothes and you are not clean till night. ğŸ§ºğŸ§¼ğŸŒ™
## Leviticus 11:29

## Leviticus 11:31

## Leviticus 11:32

## Leviticus 11:33

## Leviticus 11:34
Any food or drink in that pot is not clean. ğŸš«ğŸ²ğŸ¥¤
## Leviticus 11:35

## Leviticus 11:36

## Leviticus 11:37

## Leviticus 11:38

## Leviticus 11:39

## Leviticus 11:40

## Leviticus 11:41

## Leviticus 11:42

## Leviticus 11:43

## Leviticus 11:44

## Leviticus 15:3

## Leviticus 15:4

## Leviticus 16:1

## Leviticus 16:3

## Leviticus 16:4

## Leviticus 16:5

## Leviticus 16:11

## Ecclesiastes 1:1

## Ecclesiastes 1:2

## Ecclesiastes 1:3

## Ecclesiastes 1:4

## Ecclesiastes 1:5
The teacher saw the sun go up. The sun goes down. It goes again. ğŸŒ…ğŸŒ‡ğŸ”„
## Ecclesiastes 1:6
The teacher saw the wind blow south and blow north. It goes round and round. ğŸŒ¬ï¸ğŸ§­ğŸ”
## Ecclesiastes 1:7

## Ecclesiastes 1:8

## Ecclesiastes 1:9
What was before comes again. It is the same again. Nothing is new under the sun. ğŸ”â˜€ï¸
## Ecclesiastes 1:10

## Ecclesiastes 1:11

## Ecclesiastes 2:1

## Ecclesiastes 8:1
The Teacher says: Who is wise? A wise one knows what to do. Being wise makes your face kind and bright. ğŸ˜ŠğŸ’¡
## Ecclesiastes 8:2
The Teacher says: Obey the king. You made a promise to God to obey. ğŸ‘‘âœ‹ğŸ™
## Ecclesiastes 8:3
Do not run from the king. Do not help with bad plans. The king can do what he wants. ğŸš«ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸ‘‘
## Ecclesiastes 8:4

## Ecclesiastes 8:5

## Ecclesiastes 8:6

## Ecclesiastes 8:7

## Ecclesiastes 8:8

## Ecclesiastes 8:9

## Ecclesiastes 8:11

## Ecclesiastes 8:13

## Ecclesiastes 8:14

## Ecclesiastes 9:1
The Teacher says: I think about this. God holds good people and smart people and their work. No one knows if people will love them or hate them later. ğŸ¤”ğŸ™
## Ecclesiastes 9:2

## Ecclesiastes 9:3
The Teacher says: This is sad: all people die. People think bad things and do wild things. Then they die. ğŸ˜¢ğŸª¦
## Ecclesiastes 9:4
The Teacher says: If you are alive, you can hope. A live dog is better than a dead lion. ğŸ¶ğŸ¦
## Ecclesiastes 9:5
The Teacher says: People who live know they will die. Dead people do not know. They get no pay here. People forget them. ğŸ˜•ğŸª¦
## Ecclesiastes 9:6

## Song of Songs 1:1
The writer says: This is a love song from Solomon. ğŸµâ¤ï¸
## Song of Songs 1:2
The woman says: He gives me kisses. Your love is better than grape drink. ğŸ˜˜ğŸ‡â¤ï¸
## Song of Songs 1:3
The woman says: You smell so nice. Your name is like nice oil. Many young girls like you. ğŸŒ¸ğŸ§´ğŸ˜Š
## Song of Songs 1:4
The woman says: Please take my hand. Let us run. The king took me to his room. The friends say: We are so glad. Your love is so good. ğŸ‰ğŸƒâ€â™€ï¸ğŸ‘‘ğŸ’–
## Song of Songs 1:5
The woman says: I have dark skin, and I am pretty. Girls in the city, look at me. I am like dark tents and nice curtains. ğŸ–¤â›ºï¸ğŸ§µ
## Song of Songs 1:6
The woman says: Do not stare at me for my dark skin. The sun made me dark. My brothers were mad at me. They made me work in the grape fields. I could not care for my own field. â˜€ï¸ğŸ˜“ğŸ‡
## Song of Songs 1:7
The woman says: Tell me, my love. Where do you feed your sheep? Where do you rest at noon? I do not want to look lost by your friendsâ€™ sheep. ğŸ‘ğŸ•›â“
## Song of Songs 1:8
The man says: If you do not know, pretty girl, follow the sheep path. Take your young goats by the shepherd tents. ğŸğŸ‘£â›ºï¸
## Song of Songs 1:9
The man says: You are like a strong horse with the kingâ€™s big carts. ğŸğŸ‘‘ğŸ›
## Song of Songs 1:10
The man says: Your cheeks look nice with pretty beads. Your neck looks nice with shiny beads. ğŸ˜ŠğŸ“¿âœ¨
## Song of Songs 1:11

## Song of Songs 1:12

## Song of Songs 1:13

## Song of Songs 1:14

## Song of Songs 2:1

## Ezekiel 31:1

## Ezekiel 31:2

## Ezekiel 31:3

## Ezekiel 31:4

## Ezekiel 31:5
The tree grew taller than all the other trees. Its branches were many, because it had lots of water. ğŸŒ²â¬†ï¸ğŸ’§
## Ezekiel 31:6

## Ezekiel 31:7

## Ezekiel 31:8

## Ezekiel 31:9

## Ezekiel 31:10

## Ezekiel 31:11

## Ezekiel 31:12

## Daniel 7:1

## Daniel 7:2

## Daniel 7:3

## Daniel 7:4

## Daniel 7:8
